name: Super Volcanic AHA Pore Clearing Clay Mask
about: What it is:¬†A wash-off clay mask with volcanic clusters and AHA that helps control excess sebum, visibly minimize pores, and skin-smoothing exfoliation...Skin Type: Normal, Combination, and Oily..Skincare Concerns: Pores, Uneven Texture, and Oiliness..Formulation: Mask..Highlighted Ingredients:.- Volcanic Ash Clusters: Absorb excess sebum..- AHA (Lactic Acid): Exfoliates dead skin cells and minimizes the appearance of pores...Ingredient Callouts: Free of parabens, formaldehydes, formaldehyde-releasing agents, phthalates, mineral oil, retinyl palmitate, oxybenzone, coal tar, hydroquinone, sulfates SLS & SLES, triclocarban, triclosan, and contains less than one percent synthetic fragrance. This product is vegan, gluten-free, cruelty-free, and comes in recyclable packaging...What Else You Need to Know: This creamy, non-drying clay mask is a 10-minute facial in a jar! It is a true multi-tasker that instantly purifies pores, absorbs oils, exfoliates, and improves texture without stripping your skin. Use one to two times a week to keep clogged pores away...Clinical Results:.Based on a 1-day clinical study on 32 women ages 21 to 35:.- 94% reduction in oiliness after 1 use..- 100% showed visible improvements in pore size, skin texture & smoothness after 1 use...Based on a 1-14 day independent consumer study on 30 women ages 20-35:.- 93% felt their pores looked cleaner after 1 use..- 96% felt their pores were cleaner after using for 2 weeks..- 100% felt their skin was less oily and smooth after using for 2 weeks.....CLEAN at Sephora is our commitment to offering formulas that go beyond regulatory standards to avoid controversial ingredients without sacrificing on effectiveness.
ingredients: -Volcanic Ash Clusters: Absorb excess sebum..-AHA (Lactic Acid): Exfoliates dead skin cells and minimizes the appearance of pores...Water/Aqua/Eau, Butylene Glycol, Titanium Dioxide (CI 77891), Silica, Glycerin, Trehalose, Volcanic Ash, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Polyvinyl Alcohol, Bentonite, Kaolin, Glyceryl Stearate, Cetearyl Alcohol, PVP, 1,2-Hexanediol, PEG-100 Stearate, Polysorbate 60, Palmitic Acid, Stearic Acid, Iron Oxides (CI 77499), Hydrogenated Vegetable Oil, Xanthan Gum, Juglans Regia (Walnut) Shell Powder, Sorbitan Stearate, Zea Mays (Corn) Starch, Polyacrylate-13, Polysorbate 20, Iron Oxides (CI 77492), Mannitol, Microcrystalline Cellulose, Sodium Metaphosphate, Lactic Acid, Lactic Acid/Glycolic Acid Copolymer, Polyisobutene, Iron Oxides (CI 77491), Menthoxypropanediol, Tetrasodium Pyrophosphate, Ethylhexylglycerin, Sorbitan Isostearate, Polyquaternium-10, Lecithin, Tocopherol...The list of ingredients is subject to change, please consult the packaging of the product purchased.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Apply desired amount to your entire face or to specific areas of concern. .-Leave on for 10 minutes or until dry. .-Gently rinse by massaging in circular motions with lukewarm water. .-Use one to two times a week...Recycling Instructions:.-innisfree partners with TerraCycle¬Æ on a no-waste recycling program to give your empties a second life. .-Request your recycling envelope at https://www.terracycle.com/en-US/brigades/innisfree..-Gather all your clean products, rinse them, and place them in any box..-Log in to your TerraCycle¬Æ account at terracycle.com to download and print a free shipping label..-Drop your box off at the designated shipping provider.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Acne prone, combo ( drier in winter, oily in the summer)  I used this mask for about 3 months (may-july): At first, I noticed a slight difference the following 1-3 days after using the mask on my nose and T-zone area. It felt smoother and I thought that this mask was working and helping reduce my whiteheads and work on my blackheads. To be honest, I never really saw a change in my blackheads, but my nose did feel a lot smoother to the touch in the days following the mask treatment. I noticed my forehead (T-zone) area start to get a little bumpy but I thought it was natural purging. During this time, I would do the mask about once a week on my t-zone and the rest of my week consisted of a hydrating barrier restoring routine.   Then, I decided to use this mask on my entire face, stupidly thinking that the reduction in nose texture meant that it would help my entire face. I started breaking out pretty badly, but I thought it was again just my skin reacting to the mask. Again, I was only using this mask once a week with no other actives. The rest of my week still consisted of a hydrating barrier restoring routine. Then my skin started breaking out so badly, I have never had such a bad breakout in my life. I always considered my acne to be decently present with one or two pimples on my face (either healing or new ones) at all times with residual acne scars; in addition, I always broke out way more on my left side compared to my right side.   This breakout was so bad; it spanned both my cheeks with about 20 new cystic acne and pimple spots on each side and also my forehead. It felt like FIRE, it was so itchy, I wanted to scratch my face off, but my skin was literally hot to the touch and painful. I had three new pustules on each side almost every day, and the cystic acne was raging. From August to current day (December), I have finally healed most of the breakout and I have been left with so much scarring. This mask may work for some people, but please use with caution.

reviews.review_text: I was urged to try this during one of the in-store events that featured this brand. I am completely new to this line, and at this price I figured it wouldn't hurt to try. I have combination, aging skin, and I usually use a detox mask about once every week or two to deal with the oily portions on my face. I have a high-end brand ($$$ in price) I like to use, but honestly it's not very practical for weekly use. I tried this when I felt I needed a mid-week pick-me-up on my nose and my first impression was that I could tell it worked, but I didn't really feel blown over. I tried it another time when I needed a full-face application and that's when I realized the efficacy of this. For this price range, this is a solid workhorse to have in your skincare cabinet. A little goes a long way, too. It definitely held me over until I went in for a deeper treatment with my favorite luxe product. This is a reliable back-up to have on hand and I'm glad I gave it a try!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Deep skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: As you can see from the image below, I have the full Green Tea line with a few items not pictured as they are finished.  I LOVE THIS LINE!  As a WOC from the Caribbean, hydration, radiance, and maintaining that ‚Äúisland glow‚Äù is a non-noticeable for me, period!  I have been consistently using Korean skin care for over 4 years, with Innisfree being one of my more recent addition which I having been consistently using for almost 1 year.  I have sensitive skin and avoid heavy oil based products.  After numerous trial and error, I decided to try Innisfree‚Äôs Green Tea line which is more on the water based side.  I am soooo happy I took the chance because my skin love and soak these products up, leaving beautiful radiant/glowing skin.  My skin be skin-in‚Äô hunty! I recommend all the products in this line if you are like me with sensitive skin and appreciate clean, hydrating yet moisturizing products.  CON: The only product I didn‚Äôt care to repurchase (and I have gone through 2 bottles) is the Vitamin C.  I personally did not see a difference after using for 2 months consistently AM and PM.  Hence the 4/5 star review.  If they improve their Vitamin C potency, definitely a 5/5 line for me.  I hope this review was helpfulü§é

This is a no muss, no fuss, get it done creamy, light charcoal grey hued, kaolin clay based mask that when used once or twice per week on the oiliest parts of my combination skin (nose, chin and jawline) gently but effectively exfoliates, clarifies, deep cleans, softens and smooths skin in under 20 minutes, without leaving it overly dry or tight. All for under $20 ($15 + tax). A little goes a long way so you get a lot of bang for your buck with this beauty.   Consistent use over time, whether as a spot treatment or applied over a larger part of my face, has helped with maskne as well as periodic breakouts. It‚Äôs been an amazing ally in the fight against blackheads and breakouts. As far as clay masks go, this is in my top 3! üèÜ   Simple and simply effective. A must have for me. Highly recommend.üëçüèº

reviews.review_title: Great weekly treatment for pore size & exfoliation
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This is an amazing clay mask! I have been using it for about three weeks twice a week now, and I can definitely say it has minimized the appearance of pore size and reduced the incidence of blemishes. My skin feels very nice and smooth once I wash this mask off. I really enjoy that, unlike many other clay masks, it doesn't get uncomfortably tight and dries out your skin. This mask also has a cooling effect, which I found very soothing!  If you are looking for a weekly/twice a week treatment that feels good, serves an exfoliating purpose, and helps reduce the appearance of pores, this is definitely for you!  Some things to keep in mind, if you're interested in this mask: - Pores can't be physically shrunk nor do they just open and close at will. Masks like this just temporarily reduce the appearance by exfoliating pores. If you have more visible pores, they will not magically disappear, but this mask will significantly help shrink their appearance. Like with any mask, that effect is temporary and most visible in the few hours/day after using the mask; however, I found the effect on pore size to be longer-lasting with this mask than with other clay masks. - This mask is both a chemical and physical exfoliator, so while it does not tighten as much as other masks, it is super important to get some moisturizing ingredients on your face asap!

I even debated buying directly from innisfree because this is just such a fantastic product. Finally I got my hands on a full size and I couldn‚Äôt be happier about it. This mask will have you hooked after first use! I‚Äôve been using this for about 3/4 months now and it will be a permanent part of my skin care routine.  This mask glides on with ease. It‚Äôs not too thick that it‚Äôs difficult to spread or anything like that. It‚Äôs smooth and soft on application. It spreads so nice and even that it feels luxurious. It also dries very quickly which I really appreciate it. After rinsing my skin feels so soft and smooth it feels irresistible!! I didn‚Äôt experience any crazy purging or break outs after using. I just love what this mask does for my skin. I have noticed that since I started using this mask about once a week the break out I do get a less frequent and I experience little to no white heads. I couldn‚Äôt be happier with this mask and I absolutely highly recommend. You can‚Äôt beat the price and what it does to make my skin super soft supple clean and clear! reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I received a full-size version of this mask with innisfree's Volcanic Holiday Set. People had been raving to me about this product, so I was excited to see what the hype was about!  So now that I'm going to school again, I have to wear a mask all the time, which doesn't give me maskne, but it definitely isn't the best thing ever for my skin. Wearing a mask all the time definitely makes my pores a lot more noticeable, since there's more dirt and oil buildup, so I was intrigued to see a mask that supposedly clears pores.   Some people may not be impressed by the size of the container, but this is a VERY DENSE mask, and you really don't need a lot! At $15, this product is actually a VERY good price - most innisfree products are very affordable and a great value!  This mask was super easy to apply - it spreads really easily, and you don't need much to cover your face. Once it was on, I didn't feel any sort of burning sensation - in fact, the mask actually felt quite cooling and refreshing, which was an added bonus, since it isn't specifically a cooling mask. Another great thing about this mask is that you only need to leave it on for a relatively short period of time - 10 minutes - so it's great for people on the go!   After washing the mask off after it had been 10 minutes, I noticed that my pores looked significantly smaller and, as a result, my skin looked glowier! A lot of clay masks can be drying, but my skin actually felt hydrated after using this, which is amazing! I didn't notice any redness or bumps on my face, which I've experienced with other clay masks, especially the first time that I use them. This product is also fragrance-free which is really good for people with skin sensitive to fragrance.   In conclusion, I think that this mask is a great product for anyone and everyone - it clears pores and makes them look smaller without being overly drying, and makes your skin look really soft and smooth at a great value!

I prefer the mousse type than this jar type as the mousse one applies better too! For the price and the product def worth buy!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I just received this last week & have only used it once but from that one time, I can definitely vouch for this mask. I like how it leaves my skin feeling clean & soft afterwards. It isn‚Äôt drying, or harsh.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, mediumTan skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I received a trial sample from my most recent order of products and I am absolutely in love. My skin is very temperamental during the winter, battling a combination of dryness, flakiness, and pimples on top of a sensitivity to products. I used this as a spot treatment on pimples and they nearly disappeared the next morning! I had enough product for one mask, and it was gently exfoliated yet gave me absolutely radiant supple skin. For someone who breaks out in hives even when I use hypoallergenic products, this has mask has my full support.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Combination skin

reviews.review_title: Great affordable option with real results!

reviews.review_text: This mask is a great affordable clay mask that actually works! This mask does not irritate my skin and leaves it gently exfoliated. It leaves my face feeling fresh without it being harsh on my skin unlike other clay masks I have tried in the past. Try it out!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I use this product twice a week and it really takes care of my oily skin! I usually apply with clean hands all over, it dries within ten minutes, then I wash off. Definitely worth a repurchase once I'm done!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: it's the only mask I will ever use. it doesn't flake. you don't need much, it's not expensive and it doesn't take away all the dirt and it's cool on the face.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Definitely calmed my inflamed pimples. Doesn‚Äôt feel too tight on the face when it dries and doesn‚Äôt crack or flake when it dries. 4 stars because it comes in an unhygienic jar!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: LOVE this mask. Like LOVE. And I usually don‚Äôt get hype about products. Whenever I‚Äôm breaking out I use this and it helps so much. I love doing a little dermaplaning and then using this. My skin feels incredible the next day. And I love the price. I honestly like this brand a lot.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, mediumTan skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I almost never write reviews, but I just had to for this one... I'm even wearing the mask right now! It has such a nice cooling sensation and you barely need a little scoop to get a LOT of product. I barely made a dent in mine so far! It really does its job well, and even if it didn't, I would keep it for the nice cooling aspect alone. It doesn't have a strong smell to it, which is great, and it wasn't too messy. Overall, I would totally recommend this product!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Tan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: After one use my face became sensitive, I can‚Äôt put my regular moisturizer and eye creams on with out it burning. I‚Äôm very sad because I read all of the positive reviews and I was hoping it would work. It didn‚Äôt do anything positive for my skin. Im returning...

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This mask is so soothing and feels great on. I have sensitive skin and it doesn't irritate it at all like other clay masks can. I do find it makes my skin look clear and my pores a little smaller, and it can help calm some zits that are starting to flare up. Great price point as well.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I got this as a free sample with one of my purchases and I couldn‚Äôt believe how good this product is not to mention it‚Äôs only $15. omg I am so considering buying this mask! The moment you put it on your it feels so smooth and washing it off you really get this cold feel it‚Äôs amazing. My face feels so soft and rejuvenated and clear!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I am 42 with very sensitive combo to dry skin. Did not realize a little sample size mask with purchase would be so life changing, until now! Over the years I have tried many face masks from Drunk Elephant, Ole Henriksen, Algenist, Khiel‚Äôs, Glam Glow, and Boscia. This is the first mask I‚Äôve been so IMPRESSED with in so many ways. First, it clears the pores very well yet does not leave the skin feeling dry or stripped. Second, it gently exfoliates the skin (thank you Lactic Acid, my fave chemical exfoliant), leaving it super soft and smooth. It‚Äôs perfect to apply before skincare and makeup... preps the skin for beautiful seamless application. This mask is my new HG, it‚Äôs amazing. And at only $15, I‚Äôm hooked!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I have repurchased this probably 5 times. Its the best I've tried. It actually works without drying out the skin too much. If I feel a breakout coming on I also use this as spot treatment. Its a better deal than drugstore masks.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, gray hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I have large pores on my nose that get clogged, especially in the summer, and this product cleans them out.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Great mask for the price! I went on a whim to buy this clay mask. I‚Äôve used it twice now and love the results. My pores looks smaller and it feels like it‚Äôs clearing out my pores as well. It does have a cooling effect, which I LOVE! It feels nice on the skin and easy to clean off which is good. I know there are some clay masks that set to a firm texture and this one doesn‚Äôt do that! I‚Äôd say it‚Äôs worth it, your skin will thank you!

reviews.review_text: I love this product!! My face feels amazing! This is worth buying

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I love this clay mask. It cools down my combo skin and leaves it soft and pore less! It‚Äôs not overly tight and doesn‚Äôt irritate or dry my skin. I will be buying it again when I run out.

I don‚Äôt think this mask cleanses the pores beyond a superficial/surface-level type of ‚Äòquick‚Äô clearing. If you prefer your masks to leave you with a deeply refreshing/‚Äònew face‚Äô type of feel, this mask will leave you feeling very underwhelmed.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Love it! It‚Äôs kind of small, but the product itself is amazing. I‚Äôd put this on before a shower though.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: It‚Äôs bomb! The after feel is so fresh. It‚Äôs worth it. A little goes a long way. My pores shrunk like crazy. Definitely recommend it.

reviews.review_text: I've tried very expensive basis and this one feels so good afterwards.  I have oily skin and my t zone felt very clean but not overly stripped.   Definitely will be buying again and again

reviews.review_title: blackhead busting bang for your buck
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: My t zone is blackhead central so believe me when I say I‚Äôve tried product after product. Don‚Äôt be like me ‚Äî save your money and buy this one right now. I feel like this produced near instant results and any remaining clogged pores were easily extracted (sorry derms!) afterwards. I‚Äôve literally paid 2-3x as much for a less effective product. This one is amazing  Note: moisturise afterwards so that your skin doesn‚Äôt over compensate for the drying effect of the mask and recreate the problem it was meant to solve

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: So good.  This mask is inexpensive but is great for cleaning out my pores between facials.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I got this as a free sample and really liked it (especially the price!)- so much so that I ordered a full size. It works much, much better at getting the gunk out of the pores on my nose than clinique‚Äôs charcoal mask. And while I love The Ordinary‚Äôs salicylic acid mask, it‚Äôs pretty rough on my skin, and this is much more gentle. $15 is a steal! A little goes a long way.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: InnisFree Super Volcanic Clusters Clearing Clay Mask was a good mask.  I used this 2x a week for 2 weeks and didnt see too much of a difference but my skin did feel good afterwoods. Great for a girls night in and fun to experiment with. This was gifted by Innisfree.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I received this product complimentary from innisfree. The product comes in a greyish paste that is easy to apply. The directions are easy to read and understand. I  apply it after I put my kids to bed and relax for 10 min after I apply the mask. Then rinse with warm water and massage it off. My face feels brand new after. It is so soft and I have noticed a huge difference in pore size and the overall texture of my face. I definitely recommend this product.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Tan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This product gives me mixed feelings. (got the trial size for free from a promotion) After consistent use for 3 weeks here are my thoughts:  PROS: -I love how it isn't stripping for a clay based mask. I was able to use this on my not-as-oily areas without any dryness.  -It also chemically exfoliates using glycolic and lactic acid, and it doesn't sting my skin.  -THE PRICE is unbeatable. $15 for such a large bottle, that probably will give you enough to last for 3-4 months if you use it 2-3 time a week.   CONS: - It contains WALNUT SHELL POWDER. This is the same kind of stuff in St. Ives scrubs... As long as you don't rub your skin when washing this off you should be fine, but it still is unsettling to know it exists in this product. -It has Fragrance. Most people tend to avoid fragrance since it can be irritating, but I personally don't mind it in a wash off product like a mask. This does have a hefty fragrance smell though...  Overall, not a horrible product. It personally did not give me much results besides making my face feel more clean and oil free without over stripping it. If you're looking for something just for fun and affordable, this is a pretty solid product.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, mediumTan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I tried the Super Volcanic Clusters Pore Clearing Clay Mask. The mask felt great on my skin and you could feel it working to remove impurities. My skin felt and looked so much better after using this product. Breakouts have always been a problem, but not anymore. I highly recommend this product. I received the product as a gift from the brand in exchange for my opinion. The product was gifted by Innisfree.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: So I tried this Innisfree pore clearing clay mask and it's not bad. It might have helped my pores a little but it caused a bit of redness, but that's typical to a certain degree. I mainly didn't like the fact that it has some ingredients that are not clean to me, like PEG's, drying alcohol, walnut shell powder which can be abrasive, etc. At least there is no parabens or sulfates or other bad ingredients that I don't like. I just wish it was cleaner. It's a good price for what you get it's only $15 for 3.38 fluid ounces. If they worked on the ingredients which would also help with my somewhat sensitive skin, I would definitely give this a higher rating. I appreciate getting this gifted by Innisfree for my honest review.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Innisfree gifted me this mask for an honest review and I loved it! It‚Äôs the most comfortable clay mask that I‚Äôve ever tried. Most pore cleaning clay masks make your skin feel super tight and dry both during the time you use it and after you take it off, but this one didn‚Äôt give me a tight feeling because it doesn‚Äôt dry down like other clay masks!! It still feels hydrating and comfortable when you wear it and my skin felt soft and clean afterwards!!! The clusters are soft and don‚Äôt feel irritating at all  Using this mask also makes it really easy to extract blackheads afterwards! Would definitely purchase this on my own and 100% recommend

reviews.review_title: A must have weekly facial product!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, red hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: This is one smooth and smoothing mask. Normally I steer clear of clay masks because I have dry skin and they tend to pull oil out, which is the opposite of what I want in a skincare product. Not only does this product NOT do that, it's actually very hydrating. The application is SUPER SMOOTH for a clay mask, it glides on and the product stretches really well, a little but goes far. When it dries down it doesn't tighten up like most clays do, another great sign it isn't drying you out. After the time is up you just add a little water and massage it to get those little clusters to kind of exfoliate as well. Was easy to rinse and it left my face as smooth and ready for my night routine as good as some of my much more aggressive masks do. Innisfree is quickly becoming a favorite in my regimen. This product was gifted by innisfree to me for my HONEST review.

reviews.review_title: Love this mask for my sensitive skin
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: This product gifted by innisfree. I used it 2 weeks, twice times in a week. And waited for result to write true review. It really helps, softening, hydrating and the pores are almost gone. Love this pore clearing clay mask! And the price is really good. Will buy again.  Little #lifehack don‚Äôt forget to use rose water after every mask!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I absolutely loved this Super Volcanic Clusters Pore Clearing Clay Mask! It made my face feel so smooth and it really helped my pores decrease in size. I‚Äôve used this mask twice already and love it more each time! This product was gifted by innisfree from my honest review.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I received this Pore cleansing clay mask complimentary from Innisfree in exchange for my honest opinion.  It has a nice consistency when applying it and you can feel the super small volcanic clusters, but it does not feel rough on the skin. It is definitely cooling on your skin at contact and after washing it off, it leaves your skin super soft and smooth! I have oily skin and recommend using it once a week.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I received this product complimentary from innisfree.  I love face masks. I am slways looking for great face masks since my face can be sensitive with some products. It's a light gray color like your pretty typical clay mask. It glides very nicely across my skin and really feels nice. I feel very pampered when using this. When I rinse it off, my skin feels like it can breathe. It feels wonderful and doesn't make my skin feel tight. I love this mask! I get excited to use it everytime. I'm very happy with it and definitely recommend

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Rich skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Firstly, this product was gifted by innisfree for me to test out. I'm happy to say that there were good results over a 10 day period (used every other day)! The mask left my skin feeling firm and clean, and also helped reduce the appearance of my nose pores, which are the most visible pores on my face. Also, my face produces quite a bit of oil/sebum around my nose and under-eye area, which the mask helped remove some of the excess gunk. The scent is quite mild, so I doubt it'll bother you. Overall, a good product!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, auburn hair, lightMedium skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: This pore clearing clay mask was gifted to me from Innisfree, for my honest thoughts and opinions. This really does feel like it gave my face a deep cleaning.  It's a creamier, not so thick formula compared to other clay masks.  So it was easy to apply all over the face.  What's the time was up to remove,  I added a bit warm water to start and started massaging.  It does feel exfoliating.  I was surprised it didn't overly dry my skin out, but I still went in with a good moisturizer.  You could also use a good facial oil instead of a moisturizer to follow after the mask.  This innisfree pore clearing clay mask does have some good key ingredients, lactid acid and Jeju volcanic clusterss.  If you have dry skin like I do, then I recommend only using this no more than two times a week.  Maybe even once a week just depending on how your skin feels after.  Also don't forget to moisturize after.  I've already recommended this innisfree clearing clay mask to a family member who is having a big pore breakout.  As far as how it felt on my skin, it didn't make me itchy, irritate my skin, or any tingling.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This super volcanic cluster clay mask was gifted to me by Innisfree in exchange for my honest review. I love clay mask because I have combination skin and it gets pretty oily in my t zone. I was excited to try this particular one because I love the brand! First iff the consistency is marvelous, thick and creamy. It goes in like a dream, nice and smooth (I use a makeup brush to apply it) it doesn't take to long to dry. I will say washing it off is a bit of a pain, but that's to be expected with any clay mask. After I wash it iff though my fave feels amazing!!!! It feels so clean and fresh, but not dry... It doesn't suck all the moisture out of my skin which I love. I have seen less break outs using this mask and my skin texture as improved.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Complimentary from Innisfree for my honest opinion, I had always wanted to try Koreana beauty products and with this mask I fell in love, I have my enlarged pores and I have really seen a change in their size when using this mask, now they look smaller and I really like it  plus the appearance of my face, this product has a pleasant smell, it is easy to handle and dries quite quickly, the container brings a lot of product, after trying this mask for several days, I can fully recommend it, it is something that I would buy for myself  facial care routine.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, auburn hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I was gifted by Innisfree this Super Volcanic Clusters Pore Clearing Clay Mask , and I have been using it for a few weeks, it is amazing. My pores have gotten smaller, and my skin looks so great. It has Volcanic ash, and is a natural ingredient that forms when lava from a Volcanic eruption solidifies on Jeju Island. It really absorbs sebum, and dirt. This Innisfree clay mask is free from mineral oils or animal ingredients, and artificial fragrances. The texture is soft, and feels almost like a mousse, it spreads easy and dries quickly.  The clay in this product is good for your skin, it is a purifier, a disinfectant, and an exfoliant. This clay also unclogs pores. It has really brightened my skin, I haven't even had the occasional breakout since I've been using this. It has a very light pleasant scent, and it feels very comfortable on my face. It hasn't dried out or irritated my skin, and my face is much softer. I'm loving the Korean Beauty more and more. This is an excellent product and I will be purchasing it for sure.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, fairLight skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I received this Pore Clearing Clay Mask 2X with Super Volcanic Clusters complimentary from Innisfree, and I have to say that I really like it! The product goes on really smoothly, and I only need a little bit to fully cover my entire face. This mask does a really good job drawing gunk to the surface. I can see my pores through the mask in some places, and it gets darker where oil is being drawn to the surface. Because it is drawing things to the surface, it can create a bit of an it gets worse before it gets better effect on the skin, so I did notice some new blemishes after using. When washing off, I really like the volcanic clusters because they help scrub your face to provide some additional exfoliation as you're washing it off the face. Overall, this is one of the best clay masks I've ever used because it works exactly how I want my clay masks to work: absorbs oil, shrinks pores, isn't overly drying, and is obviously drawing things out of my pores and to the surface of my skin.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Medium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: This Jeju Super Volcanic Clay Mask was gifted by Innisfree to review!  This clay mask is deep cleansing; formulated with absorbent Jeju Super Volcanic Clusters and AHA, that helps clear pores while it exfoliates.  Ingredients: Their key ingredient Jeju Volcanic Clusters, are finely ground hardened volcanic lava that helps absorb excess sebum. While Lactic Acid exfoliates dead skin cells and minimizes the appearance of pores.  Now this product, like a few other controversial products does contain Walnut shell in powder form. It‚Äôs not very high on the ingredient list, and unlike other brands that have use it in exfoliators- this mask isn‚Äôt rubbed excessively over the face in scrubbing motions, so I don‚Äôt think the skin will suffer from any lesions it can make. However, I DO know that people can be allergic to this ingredient so I would definitely be careful if you have had any allergic reactions to nuts or skincare products containing nuts!  My Experience: I actually quite enjoyed this mask. It was thick in texture and easy to apply with fingers or a spatula. It didn‚Äôt dry to some hard rock like texture, which I loved because I hate feeling like my facial movements get restricted. It was easy to rinse off after 15 minutes with warm water and I have zero complaints about my skin!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: This innisfree Pore Cleansing Mask 2X with Super Volcanic Clusters was gifted to me by innisfree for free in exchange for my honest review.   I love this clay mask and I don‚Äôt usually like masks. But this one doesn‚Äôt have a strong tightening effect, which I loved!   I left this on for the recommended time of ten minutes before rinsing with lukewarm water and wiping off with a wet washcloth. It came off super easy and left my skin soft and glowing. I love this mask!   This product is especially good for oily skin, which I don‚Äôt have. But if you do, you‚Äôll love this.   The container it came in is awesome! Once I‚Äôm finished with the product, I‚Äôll clean and reuse the jar for something else because it‚Äôs so cute.   The mask has a slight sense that is light and airy. It‚Äôs definitely not overwhelming.   This mask gets a five star review from me. Thank you, innisfree.

It comes in a cardboard box and the tub is actually plastic which is nice.  Its a heavy little guy so you get a ton of mask in this product, enough to mask twice a week for several months.

reviews.review_title: Gentle clay mask -- comfortable but effective
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: As far as clay masks go, this is pretty gentle. My skin is very acneic, so I wanted something that I could use on a semi-regular basis to draw out the pimples before a decent extraction session. However, I didn't want anything too stripping, so this worked out great. It isn't a hydrating clay mask like some Korean brands can be, but it's not as harsh as a GlamGlow or an Aztec Clay. There is a tingling sensation when you put it on and it still does manage to draw things out and leave your face feeling super-clean. I use this once a week at most because I don't like drying out my already dry skin, but it definitely feels like it pulls stuff up. In the long term, this is a good once-in-a-white product for people who are battling long-term acne and are still waiting for their prescriptions to finish purging. I can't comment on how it is for non-acneic skin.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Fair skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: A product needs to be either REALLY amazing or REALLY bad for me to take the time to write a review. So TRUST me when I say that this product feels nice (soothing, easy to put on, easy to take off)....but does absolutely NOTHINGG for pores or skin texture etc. If you truly want something for your pores, do not believe the hype on this one. Sorry :(

reviews.review_text: I received this product complimentary from Innisfree, however my reviews are always 100% honest.   Out of all the products in the Innisfree Pore Clearing line, this one is my absolute favorite for a couple of reasons:  1) This product actually works! I have combination skin with my t-zone being oily while other parts of my face can be dry/flaky if I do not both chemically and manually exfoliate routinely. This mask was gentle enough to use all over my face - it worked well at balancing my oily t-zone while also not being too drying on the other areas of my face.  2) The formulation is just amazing - lots of chemical exfoliants are present in additional to the mechanical exfoliants, making this a great product for weekly use to give your skin an instant refresher. What makes this product even better? It has zero questionable ingredients in it including the absence of parfum/fragrance.   3) The price point for the quality. I have tried so many products similar to this over the past couple years that can be upwards of 3-5 times the price of this one, and actually prefer this/find it equitable to a few of the more premium-priced comparable.  All in all, I definitely would recommend this for pretty much anyone. I also have sensitive skin and did not find this to be irritating, or cause any redness whatsoever, hence just another reason why I gave this a solid 5/5.

I could tell a difference in the size of my pores and it took all the oil from my face. After just one use my face looked brighter and had a more even tone. The innisfree pore clearingclay mask really does its job. It is an amazing product and brand. I will definitely continue to purchase this product  and I'm excited to try many more products from innisfree.

reviews.review_text: I am SO disappointed in this being sold at Sephora!!!! I selected this as a sample with one of my orders. Totally my fault. I did not read the ingredients. I assumed they would all be great for my skin. I struggle with small blackheads from time to time and occasional acne. After getting my skin care routine in order it has really helped to balance out my skin and I have not gotten acne and only have occasional blackheads. So I like to use a charcoal or clay mask 1-2x a week to clean all of the sebum out of my pores. I think everyone should use a charcoal or clay mask atleast once a week-no matter what skin type you are!! Seeing that this mask had clay and volcanic ash made me really interested in trying it! I can honestly say I have never tried a product with volcanic ash. The mask was somewhat hard to apply to my skin. It was creamy but it was very dry. I was able to cover my entire face, I am just used to very creamy masks. Applying it to my face it actually felt grainy, which I was surprised about. It felt fine while I had it on for the 10 minutes. It did not burn or bother my skin at all. Once it came time to rinse it off was when I noticed a HUGE problem! It actually HURT to rinse off! It felt like tiny pieces of glass while rinsing my face!!! I have used exfoliating masks before like the Origins Rose clay mask that uses jojoba beads (very good ingredient for exfoliating!) I have also used sugar and coffee scrubs but realized that they are too harsh for skin. I went to look up the ingredients in this mask and it contains WALNUT SHELL POWDER!!!! That is HARSH on skin and it is no wonder it hurt my face while rinsing it off!!!! Through out the entire day my skin felt and looked inflamed, it burnt and it did feel like there were tiny scratches all over it!!! I used a moisturizing mask immediately afterward and layered on heavy moisturizer after that and again at night. I will NEVER use a mask with shell powder, sugar or coffee again!!!
